content: Looking at the FHIR NPM Package Specification it references a url element, that matches ImplementationGuide.manifest.rendering. At what point in the publication process does this get populated in the IG resource and package.json, because I don't see it in my local build output, or in Registry packages? Or is this a manual step?
likely that last magical invocation of the builder... possibly the -publish-update or the -go-publish... no idea what the difference is

Grahame Grieve said:

which isn't populated?

Either ImplementationGuilde.manifest.rendering or package.json's url element in the output of IG publisher, and on the project I'm working on that's been pushed to the registry by Simplifier.
I can't speak to what Simplifier does but I thought I was populating package.json/url
Is it something that should be done as part of the publication process, or just the build?
normal build. I don't think that the publication process ever changes the package

@Elliot Silver For publishing via Simplifier.net you could just update that URL in your project's package.json before you publish a package. It should then make it to the package.json in your resulting package.
